kesako.watcher.runnable

Class IndexFileProcess

  • java.lang.Object
    • kesako.watcher.runnable.IntervalDBWork
      • kesako.watcher.runnable.IndexFileProcess
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class IndexFileProcess
extends IntervalDBWork
    Process that index files within a batch of nbFiles.
    To do that, the process takes the first nbFiles where the field flag = Constant.TO_INDEXED.
    If the file's indexing ended with no error, the field flag is updated to Constant.INDEXED, else the flag is updated to Constant.INDEXE_ERROR.
    The class implements the Log4J logging system.
    Author:
    Frederic SACHOT

      • logger

        private static final org.apache.log4j.Logger logger
        Log4J logger of the class.

      • indexingBatch

        private static boolean indexingBatch
        indicate if an indexing batch is running.
        It's a static variable to be sure that only one indexing process is running at all times.

      • idFileToIndex

        list of id of files to process within a batch

    • Constructor Detail

      • IndexFileProcess

        public IndexFileProcess(int intervalSeconds,
                int nbFile)
        Constructor of the indexing process. The process run in a specific thread.
        Parameters:
        intervalSeconds - number of seconds between to indexing batch
        nbFile - maximum number of files that can be processed within a batch.

    • Method Detail

      • startWorking

        public void startWorking()
        Clean the index, and initialize the thread.
        Overrides:
        startWorking in class IntervalDBWork

      • cleanIndex

        private void cleanIndex(java.sql.Connection cn,
              long start)
        Verify that all files in the index are referenced in the data-base.
        If a file in the index is not referenced in the data-base, it is suppressed from the index.

      • doWork

        protected void doWork()
        Execute the indexing process.
        The process begin by a batch of document to suppress, and then continue with a batch of document to index.
        Specified by:
        doWork in class IntervalDBWork

      • initContentStream

      • indexFile

        private void indexFile(java.sql.Connection cn,
             int idFichier)
        Index the file fToIndex.
        To index a file, the method create a ContentStreamUpdateRequest object with the url "/update/extract".
        Then the object is initialized with initContentStream method, and sent to SOLR server.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException
        org.apache.solr.client.solrj.SolrServerException

      • suppressFileFromIndex

        private void suppressFileFromIndex(java.sql.Connection cn,
                         int idFichier)
                            throws org.apache.solr.client.solrj.SolrServerException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Suppress a file from the index and from the data-base.
        If a Source is empty (no file), the source is suppress from the data-base.
        To suppress a source from the index, update the field flag to Constant.TO_SUPPRESS in the table T_sources. The index process will suppress all files from the index and the source from the data-base.
        Parameters:
        uri -
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException
        org.apache.solr.client.solrj.SolrServerException
